feature.name: daily_wage_calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily_wage_calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a greyed-out formula in the leave policy that is overridden by the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for unpaid leave deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by defaulting to 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with detailed breakdown showing system follows a specific calculation logic
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration splitting and tiered daily rate application
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in gratuity calculation method

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential inconsistency in counting leap year days for service duration calculation
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent documentation about leap year day inclusion in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system calculates service duration with specific rules for leap years, using 366 as a divisor when the partial year includes a leap year, which can differ from manual calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, potentially leading to misunderstandings about partial year and leap year processing.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Days Worked Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. An extra day seems to be added incorrectly to the total working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor inconsistency in days worked calculation method
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision in days calculation needs review to ensure exact working days are captured

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The specific case showed a calculation using 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to policy configuration, with a fixed divisor that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in explaining how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system calculates proration correctly using the configured work week, which in this case had all 7 days marked as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating based on actual working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic does not handle salary calculations for employees with future departure dates correctly
known_issues.gap_statement: Product lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between the Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes inconsistent daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Method
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses non-standard 30.42 day divisor, potentially causing deduction amounts to exceed expected monthly salary
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the actual calculation being mathematically correct. This is a display bug in the remarks field where the wrong number of days is referenced.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect unpaid leave deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not match the leave occurrence month, showing rates from the payroll processing month instead.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request.

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a 26 working days per month standard, calculated as 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required for variations in employee attendance

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be used.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to control unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations depend on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the system may use outdated salary information for deduction calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions and manual intervention required

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in gratuity calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Pro-Rated Salary Calculation Precision Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations (basic + allowances / 30) consistently produce slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision handling.
limitations.impact: Affects accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Accrual for Mid-Month Departures
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically claim partial month's leave balance

limitations.title: Service Days Calculation Ambiguity
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including departure date and leap year days
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Precise Service Period Measurement
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates service duration with granular precision, breaking down service periods into specific segments (e.g., years, months, days) with special handling for incomplete years and leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies between manual and system calculations due to complex day-counting methodology

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for clients with different wage computation preferences

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows predefined policy configurations that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for unique monthly variations or specific employee circumstances.

limitations.title: Monthly Fluctuations in Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. This means the daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
limitations.impact: Accrual amounts will vary month-to-month due to different working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and manual configuration required to match client expectations

limitations.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar day expectations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inability to Automatically Remove Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
limitations.impact: Users must manually manage payroll deductions after leave request modifications

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction accuracy when public holidays or working days configuration changes mid-cycle

limitations.title: No Automatic Retroactive Corrections
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate salary deductions retroactively when configuration changes occur after initial calculation.
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required for calculation discrepancies

limitations.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction calculations may not precisely match expected monthly salary amounts

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate pro-rata calculations for unpaid leave and daily wage computations

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays. Working days are determined by subtracting public holidays from total calendar days.
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows a greyed-out formula in the leave policy that is overridden by the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for unpaid leave deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by defaulting to 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with detailed breakdown showing system follows a specific calculation logic

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system calculates service duration with specific rules for leap years, using 366 as a divisor when the partial year includes a leap year, which can differ from manual calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Days Worked Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. An extra day seems to be added incorrectly to the total working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The specific case showed a calculation using 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system calculates proration correctly using the configured work week, which in this case had all 7 days marked as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating based on actual working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between the Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes inconsistent daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the actual calculation being mathematically correct. This is a display bug in the remarks field where the wrong number of days is referenced.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect unpaid leave deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a 26 working days per month standard, calculated as 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be used.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations depend on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the system may use outdated salary information for deduction calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in gratuity calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Salary Calculation Precision Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations (basic + allowances / 30) consistently produce slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision handling.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Accrual for Mid-Month Departures
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Service Days Calculation Ambiguity
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including departure date and leap year days

claims_to_validate.title: Precise Service Period Measurement
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates service duration with granular precision, breaking down service periods into specific segments (e.g., years, months, days) with special handling for incomplete years and leap years.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows predefined policy configurations that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Fluctuations in Daily Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. This means the daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future

claims_to_validate.title: Inability to Automatically Remove Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: No Automatic Retroactive Corrections
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate salary deductions retroactively when configuration changes occur after initial calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays. Working days are determined by subtracting public holidays from total calendar days.
